name: TTR Moonstone Apart Hotel
address: 86 Đường Lý Tự Trọng, Đà Lạt, Việt Nam
description:
Nằm ở Đà Lạt, cách Sân golf Dalat Palace Golf Club 1.9 km, TTR Moonstone Apart Hotel cung cấp chỗ nghỉ có xe đạp miễn phí, chỗ đậu xe riêng miễn phí, khu vườn và sân hiên. Khách sạn 2 sao này cung cấp nhà hàng. Chỗ nghỉ cung cấp lễ tân 24/24, dịch vụ đưa đón sân bay, dịch vụ phòng và Wi-Fi miễn phí.

Các căn đi kèm TV màn hình phẳng có truyền hình cáp, tủ lạnh, ấm đun nước, vòi xịt/chậu rửa vệ sinh, đồ vệ sinh cá nhân miễn phí và bàn làm việc. Với phòng tắm riêng được trang bị vòi sen và máy sấy tóc, một số phòng tại khách sạn cũng có view thành phố. Tại TTR Moonstone Apart Hotel, các phòng được thiết kế có ga trải giường và khăn tắm.

Đi xe đạp là hoạt động được ưa chuộng trong khu vực. Ngoài ra, chỗ nghỉ có dịch vụ thuê ô tô.

TTR Moonstone Apart Hotel cách Quảng trường Lâm Viên 1.9 km và Hồ Xuân Hương 2.2 km. Sân bay gần nhất là Sân bay Liên Khương, cách khách sạn 28 km.

review.comment_positive:
Very nice hotel in Da Lat, well located in a quiet area, with some great coffee shops & cafes located within easy walking distance. The hotel is well set out with a relaxing lobby, working elevators.  I liked the hotel carries motorcycles or push bikes for hire.
The room was comfortable but lacked a window.  Did have a small window facing the walkway, but no view. 
The staff are fantastic and helpful in many ways. I accidentally forgot to check the safe on departure and left our passports there. The staff were just great, organising the passports in the mail the same day.
Thank you for a relaxing and great stay.
Must go up the hill 1 morning for a coffee, at Stop & Go Cafe... along Art Street, and listen to the music of talented young musicians.

review.rating: Okay accommodation, great location, go somewhere else for breakfast
review.room_type: Phòng Superior Có Giường Cỡ King
review.comment_positive: Great location. Rooms were spacious and comfortable and decor was more modern than some of the other places we’ve stayed in Vietnam.
review.comment_negative:
There wasn’t a lot of variety at breakfast (and the dishes that were available didn’t look particularly appealing), most of the items were cold or lukewarm and breakfast was often late (advertised as opening at 7am but on 2 of our 3 nights the breakfast was still being setup at 7:15 which made it tight to get ready for the start of our tour). 

Unfortunately reception couldn’t get the safe to unlock when we arrived (previous guest must have left it closed), which we would have used if it was available. 

The shower casing had gaps in it which made the bathroom flood whenever we had a shower so it was more like a wet room than a shower. 

There was also damp/mould on the curtains as there must have not been good air circulation in the room (there was condensation in the windows overnight) which meant there was often a musky smell in the room. 

All sounds quite negative but the room was nice and did the job for our short stay in Dalat, so nothing major. Suggest travellers choose an option where breakfast isn’t included as you’ll find better options outside of the hotel.

review.rating: Unacceptable behavior from staff ! Avoid it, completely overrated !
review.comment_negative:
Very overrated hotel. I cannot understand the 9.6. The staff does not speak a word in English. The picture of the hotel is an old one, they is a huge construction next to it now with works. The worst thing is that because of a room switch, the staff decided to move all our belongings when we were out during the day ! Without asking permission, without letting us know and without being able to explain as they do not speak English. What a surprise to come back from the day and finding our room open and empty. Our stuff were obviously not even packed so they moved everything randomly. Over the top, our checkout was at 12pm and we had the surprise to receive a call from reception at 11:30 telling us it was time to leave the room.
The road in front of the hotel is very noisy. I would definitely not recommend.

review.comment_positive: Location is good. Room was clean. Bed was comfy.
review.comment_negative:
Our room was like a cell. It had 4 white walls with one small window that went onto the corridor. That window had no blind/curtain, and so the lights from the corridor shone in all night. The photo attached was taken at 10:30pm. There was so much noise of people !!3 floors down!! That we heard every word in our room, it was about 11:30pm I asked reception to tell them to be quiet, it didn’t help. 
Same again 6:30am heard everyone going for breakfast, not the hotels fault for having loud disrespectful guests, but it says a lot about the rooms not being sound proof. 
Breakfast was average, like any other hotel really, not very continental- note not everyone wants to eat noodle soup for breakfast. It cost extra £9 for breakfast it wasn’t worth that at all. But the room was real cheap, did a job for one night.

review.rating: Underwhelmed and unimpressed by poor service and dirty hotel.
review.comment_positive: The location is close to the night market and central lake, but far enough away to not be in the bustle.
review.comment_negative:
There was a building under construction next door and it was noisy and dusty. After a long day we arrived the “VIP” one-bedroom that was supposed to be nice and have an extra bed in the living room was on the lobby floor with a sliding door that opened to the parking lot, where people were smoking and being noisy. To boot, the bedroom had no windows and there were no fans or air conditioners to manage the stuffiness. We inquired about another option and the front desk clerk, a young man, begrudgingly offered a cramped and very dirty room one floor up with two king beds. 

We agreed to change because we were tired but in the morning asked for a price adjustment for the huge difference in room quality, being willing to suffer through for one more night, knowing we would only be sleeping in the room as we explored the area. Another, kinder, young female desk clerk said she didn’t have the authority to refund us called the owner to try to get permission and was denied. With that we had noted that other, better looking but still less costly, rooms were available online that night so we asked to be moved and she agreed. We also asked for a complimentary later checkout the following day (one hour past normal checkout) and she relented.

When we went to check out the next day the same young man attempted to charge us 30% of the nightly rate for our “late” departure. He called the owner, who also wanted to charge, and insisted until we explained that the other clerk had allowed it and he followed up and called her. 

Overall our absolute worst experience with hospitality in two weeks of wonderful experiences in Vietnam. I would definitely not return and would never recommend staying here. Also, the breakfast buffet was mediocre at best.

我觉得这是我这辈子花的最值的几百块钱。

The area is pretty near some amazing places to eat, so it's a totally great location as well.
review.comment_negative:
The room was just beside a construction site, and with the walls being a tad too thin, we had some issues getting some shut eye during the afternoons.
We also have very disruptive guests on our floor who were smoking and talking loudly along the corridors. We needed to call the reception to complain even though they had cctv footage, but he was confused and even knocked on our door to clarify when the other guest was just standing along our corridor which I felt was alittle worrying as we were a group of just ladies.

review.comment_positive: 이렇게 불편했던 숙소는 처음이에요.
review.comment_negative:
고객 응대가 너무나 불친절했어요.
저희가 방문하기 하루 전날 수도가 고장나서 저희가 예약한 방을 사용할 수 없음을 미리 알려주지 않았습니다.
사전에 조치한 사항이 하나도 없었어요.
체크인할 때 다른 저렴한 방을 대신 제공하겠다며 선심쓰듯 얘기한 것도 숙박객 입장에서는 너무나도 불편했네요.
2박을 예약했는데 이틀째도 다른 방으로 이동해야 한다며 짐을 싸서 옮기라고 하더라구요.
직원은 숙박객에게 숙소 컨디션이 안 좋은 곳을 쓰게 하면서 일방적인 태도로 숙박객을 불편하게 만들었습니다.

the staff are extremely nice and helpful. I checked in very late and I felt well taken care of.
